references.name: Professor Tommaso Di Noia
references.reference: Tommaso Di Noia is a Professor of Computer Science at Politecnico di Bari, Italy, specializing in Artificial Intelligence and Data Management. His early research focused on knowledge representation, automated reasoning, and knowledge-aware resource retrieval. He later applied these techniques to automated negotiations, mobile computing, and protocols, expanding to knowledge graphs and Linked Open Data for user modeling and recommender systems. His recent work explores theoretical, algorithmic, and experimental aspects of recommender systems, emphasizing security and privacy, including adversarial and federated machine learning. A recipient of prestigious awards like the IBM Ph.D. Fellowship and HP Labs Innovation Research Program, he has published extensively, earning multiple Best Paper Awards.

references.name: Professor Fedelucio Narducci
references.reference: Fedelucio Narducci is a Full Professor at the Polytechnic University of Bari, specializing in recommender systems, conversational agents, and natural language processing. With a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Bari Aldo Moro, his research spans e-health, user modeling, fairness, and explainability in AI. He has held research roles at Philips Research, the University of Milano Bicocca, and the University of Bari, focusing on diverse topics like emotion-aware systems and multilingual e-gov services. A prolific author with over 100 publications, he has co-authored a book on semantics in adaptive systems and served as an Associate Editor for leading journals, including Decision Support Systems and the International Journal of Human-Computer Studies.

references.name: Dr. Vito Walter Anelli
references.reference: Vito Walter Anelli, a researcher and academic at Politecnico di Bari, holds a Ph.D. in Electrical and Information Engineering. His work spans Machine Learning, Recommender Systems, Linked Open Data, and Semantic Web technologies. He has developed innovative algorithms for recommendation diversification, fairness, and hybrid systems leveraging knowledge graphs. His research also explores adversarial learning, cross-domain recommendations, and semantic representations.

projects.name: RITA Copilot
projects.summary: RITA Copilot is a Road Information and Travel Assistant AI that integrates various services for voice recognition, natural language processing, and text-to-speech. It acts as a copilot to assist drivers by providing real-time traffic updates, suggesting optimal routes, locating nearby services, offering mechanical advice, and facilitating emergency assistance when needed.

projects.name: RecMOE
projects.summary: A library for computing Pareto fronts and evaluating them with Quality Indicators (QIs) for Recommender Systems. Officially released following the acceptance of the paper titled 'Broadening the Scope: Evaluating the Potential of Recommender Systems Beyond Prioritizing Accuracy.

projects.name: POI recommendation through GNNs on heterogeneous graphs
projects.summary: This project, conducted during a research internship at Universidad Autónoma de Madrid, developed a hybrid recommendation system using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) and heterogeneous graphs to improve Point of Interest recommendations. By addressing limitations in traditional methods, the system demonstrated enhanced accuracy and contextual awareness through richer data representation.

projects.name: Fairness in a Student Performance Data Set
projects.summary: The project uses Logistic Regression, Random Forest, and Support Vector Machine as base models to investigate Bias and Fairness in Machine Learning. The project aims to explore advanced techniques for enhancing fairness in machine learning models, focusing on novel approaches to achieve fairness in classification tasks.

projects.name: Oil Spills Semantic Segmentation
projects.summary: Employing various Deep Convolutional Neural Networks on Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) images for the purpose of Oil Spill detection. Multiple models were trained, incorporating techniques such as data augmentation and transfer learning. Ultimately, the most effective model for segmentation, identified as DeepLabV3+ (ResNet101), emerged from these efforts.

projects.name: Restaurant Recommendation System
projects.summary: Leveraging the capabilities of Spark and MLlib, we conducted an array of data analysis tasks on the Restaurants and Consumers dataset curated by UCI ML. These tasks encompass a spectrum of analyses, ranging from fundamental statistical examinations to intricate business-economic analyses. The culmination of our efforts involves the application of Machine Learning techniques to construct a recommendation engine, utilizing the Collaborative Filtering algorithm, specifically the alternating least squares (ALS) algorithm.

projects.name: Go-Interpreter-In-Python
projects.summary: A Go Interpreter written in Python using Lark a modern parsing library for Python.

projects.name: Swift-Interpreter-in-GO
projects.summary: A swift interpreter written in Go using the Pratt Parsing technique.

projects.name: Remote Car Key Hack
projects.summary: I have adapted an external 2.0 sound card by incorporating a 433 MHz RF transmission and reception module to serve both as a receiver and a transmitter. This modification is aimed at capturing the remote signal of my car and replicating it to unlock the vehicle.

projects.name: NCP The Game
projects.summary: NCP is an Android game where players guide a Pig through floating islands, avoiding deadly bombs to survive. With minimalistic graphics and quick rounds, players tap to control the character's jumps and navigate the challenging landscape.
